item.description:
Lecture & Discussion

Lecture at the HMNH:
Why Humans Run: the Biology and Evolution of Marathon Running.
Humans are "born to run," but why are we so unique among mammals in this ability? Harvard Professor of Anthropology Daniel E. Lieberman explores the idea that evolution helped shape the human body, in part, to perform well at sustained, long-distance running. Such athleticism may have been an integral part of early human hunting or scavenging behaviors, and although no longer necessary for our survival, still persists as a legacy of our evolutionary history. Free and open to the public. 6:00 PM

Discussion afterwards at The Temple Bar;
"What (if any) is the relationship between evolution and culture?"
Temple Bar
1688 Mass. Avenue
Cambridge, MA 02138
item.name: Lecture & Discussion
